page.title: 01OUT SKERRIES
page.content: { { Out Skerries}consists of three tiny {islands,}two linked by a bridge and the third, across a narrow strip of water, privately owned. These islands form a superb sheltered{harbour}which has made this rocky 600 acres a place where fishermen have lived for centuries. In a time when{remote communities}are fighting for their survival, Skerries is flourishing, with a new{ro-ro pier and upgraded{airstrip (1985),}a{fish {farm}and{factory,}as well as a three- boat fleet. Mains{electricity}was connected in 1983. Enough young people remain to live and work on the islands to maintain a viable community. Apart from teachers, nurse and missionary there are no 'outsiders' resident.The island has a {primary}and a{secondary school.
